comments.body: Is this needed? Outdent should be always before end marker and from what I see we don't need it below.

For empty template body, there is no indent/outdent
```scala
object Foo: // <- here at colon  we call `observeIndented` while the next line doesn't have any indentation
end Foo
```

Generally, it should end on the LF after `:`, but this doesn't seem to happen and we are skipping the LF. That would be the underlying issue here. However, not sure how to fix it properly, so it's ok for now.

and would this work:
```
object Foo:
// comment
end Foo
```
@kitbellew yep. Parser ignores comments in the same way as whitespaces

sorry for being a pain but this is something that i learned the hard way in scalafmt. does prev refer to the previous token, skipping both whitespace and comments?

will this handle something like that:
```
    foo match // blah
    case bar => ...
    end match // blah
  case qux => ...
```

It skips them:
```scala
    def prev: Token = {
      val prev = scannerTokens.apply(Math.max(token.index - 1, 0))
      if (prev.is[Whitespace] || prev.is[Comment]) prev.prev
      else prev
    }
```

what about this:
```
val end = ...
end match
case theend => ...
end match
```
this doesn't compile in Dotty from what I see.
why not? `end` is not restricted https://scalacenter.github.io/scala-3-migration-guide/docs/incompatibilities/syntactic-changes.html#restricted-keywords

Might be a bug? Or really there is a number of scenarios, where soft keywords don't work, but it's not stated.

Same with:
```scala
def extension(a : Int) = a + 2
extension(2)
```
will not work.

You need to do:
```scala
def extension(a : Int) = a + 2
`extension`(2)
```

So soft keywords are kind of dodgy and when I asked Martin he said that this is fine.
https://github.com/lampepfl/dotty/issues/10076 for some context (I kind of argued with him there :sweat_smile: )

We should have `RegionIndent` and the `RegionParen` next - instead of just dropping it.

It will be applied one more time.
After `observerIndented` were called the next token after `Indent` will be `(` that will put `RegionParen` again.

For example, in the code below at the moment when `observeIndented` is called iterator already reached `(` token on the second line and updated `sepRegions` on `RegionParen :: Nil`.

```scala
if (cond)
  <(>f)
```

comments.body: Removed `abstract givens cannot be annonymous` here since it's actually misleading. Givens with `with` cannot be abstract at all.

comments section for this method:
` // GivenDef          ::=  [GivenSig] [â€˜_â€™ â€˜<:â€™] Type â€˜=â€™ Expr`
are no longer relevant, probably best to remove
Updated!

There is a line above:
`val (sigName, sigTparams, sigUparamss) = if (token.is[Colon]) {`
according to spec colon must always be present.
At least one of sigName, sigTparams, sigUparamss must be present.
With this there is probably no need to fork and rollback how it was done before.

Someone noticed parsing was not straightforward and adjusted syntax? :)

You can still have:
`given Ord[Int] with { def compare(x: Int, y: Int): Int = 0 }` 

which does not contain `:`, since `[GivenSig]` is optional.
ahh right ðŸ‘
